bulletPoints: Spearheaded the development of elegant web user interfaces and desktop applications integral to cutting-edge scientific instruments, including advanced gas and particle analysers.
Collaborated closely with scientists and engineers to design and deliver robust software that fulfills business and technical requirements.

Shipped exciting new customer-centric features into the UI of a novel product using React, Next.js, Zendesk Garden, TypeScript, Node.js and GraphQL. This endeavor not only augmented the UX but also elevated the product's market appeal.

Assumed a leadership role in the complete software lifecycle of a high-performance, multi-threaded desktop application for live data capture and visualisation, developed using Python, PySide6 (Qt), Scipy and Numpy. This application speeded up the mechanical development of a new product by 10x.

Delivered 4 multi-million pound software projects for instrument clusters and other automotive systems across 10+ vehicle programmes (2M+ production vehicles) by managing projects, collaborating with suppliers, planning sprints, resolving defects, and releasing software to production.

Reduced the software download time by 98% by introducing Diagnostics-over-IP (DoIP) which involved gathering stakeholder requirements, authoring software specifications, and running unit/integration/end-to-end tests.
Reduced 200K+ man-hours of service dealership costs and improved the customer experience by delivering over-the-air software update capabilities.
Fixed 800+ software defects by leading defect reviews in Jira, analysing logs, reproducing issues, finding root cause, and validating fixes.

Met new scalability and real-time requirements by migrating the software stack to a new platform utilising a service-oriented architecture by architecting software, and designing algorithms/APIs using SOME-IP and DDS.
